description.plain:
Joseph Saddler (born January 1, 1958 in     South Bronx, New York), better known as Grandmaster Flash, is a Bajan-American hip hop recording artist and DJ.

He is considered to be one of the pioneers of hip-hop DJing, cutting, scratching and mixing. Grandmaster Flash & The Furious Five were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2007, becoming the first hip hop act to be honored.

body.plain:
Joseph Saddler (born January 1, 1958 in     South Bronx, New York), better known as Grandmaster Flash, is a Bajan-American hip hop recording artist and DJ.

He is considered to be one of the pioneers of hip-hop DJing, cutting, scratching and mixing. Grandmaster Flash & The Furious Five were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2007, becoming the first hip hop act to be honored.

songs.full_title: Grandmaster Flash - The Message (Annotating a Legend Fall 2015 Mid- Term) by Grandmaster Flash
songs.title: Grandmaster Flash - The Message (Annotating a Legend Fall 2015 Mid- Term)
songs.title_with_featured: Grandmaster Flash - The Message (Annotating a Legend Fall 2015 Mid- Term)

description.plain: The message is a 1982 political hip-hop song by Grandmaster flash and the furious five. The song is very conscious about the social ills of the living conditions that African Americans have succumb to in their neighborhood during the time period. The message played a role in taking rap music from a house party tracks to more socially conscious lyrics which would later influence other rap groups such as Public Enemy and N.W.A

Creatures were playin' cards (Igor was cuttin' the deck)
Somebody screamed (There's Dracula,cover your neck)
Now Lurch was rockin' the mix and on his shirt it read
The music hideously provided for the living dead
Now they was illin' and that was no doubt

Frankstein was steady scheming as he left the room

'Ramo!' ('Ramo!')
Raah!

The rise and fall, the last great empire, the sound of the whole world caught on fire
The ruthless struggle, the desperate gamble

songs.full_title: The Message Midterm (Keep Booging Fall 2015 UTA) by Grandmaster Flash
songs.title: The Message Midterm (Keep Booging Fall 2015 UTA)
songs.title_with_featured: The Message Midterm (Keep Booging Fall 2015 UTA)

description.plain:
“The Message” was released in 1982 by Grandmaster Flash & The Furious Five as the first hip-hop song addressing the socio-economic problems of African American communities. Grandmaster Flash was born Joseph Saddler on January 1, 1958 in Barbados and later moved to South Bronx, New York. The city had lost 178,000 manufacturing from 1977 to 1989 inciting Jimmy Carter’s visit to witness the devastation in person.



Joseph Saddler
